questions.question_text: A new datacenter is being created, and management is trying to control access to that area. Which of the following are the BEST choices for providing access to the new datacenter? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Questions talks about the "area" so physical location

questions.question_text: A network technician is capturing packets on the network and notices a UDP packet stream from a phone to the PBX system. The payload of the packet shows the phone downloaded the file cm7910-sccp-load-2995.xml. Which of the following protocols was MOST likely used to download this file?

discussion.content: @Halaa, SIP uses both TCP and UDP
Someone explain this to me. I thought it was SIP

choices.B: in a subnet isolated from the internal network.

questions.question_text: A server administrator is building an email server. To protect the corporate/internal network from external users, the email server should be placed:

comments.content: *To protect the corporate/internal network from external users*
I suppose the email server needs internet access, unless its an internal-only email system (which seems unlikely).

questions.question_text: A security manager asks the network administrator to block VoIP protocols using the default ports on the corporate firewall. Which of the following ports should be blocked to prevent this type of traffic from going outside the company's network? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: 5061 and 5060 are SIP, 1720 is h.232 rest are void

questions.question_text: When connecting to a network device through a remote connection for configuration purposes, which of the following protocols is MOST secure?
